Package org.apache.logging.log4j.spi

Interface ScopedContextProvider

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractScopedContextProvider
public interface ScopedContextProvider
The service underlying ScopedContext.
Since:
2.24.0

  • Method Details

    • simple

      static ScopedContextProvider simple()

    • getContextMap

      Map<String,?> getContextMap()
      Returns:
      An immutable map with the current context data.

    • addContextMapTo

      default void addContextMapTo(StringMap map)
      Adds the current data to the provided StringMap.
      Parameters:
      map - The StringMap to add data to.

    • getValue

      Object getValue(String key)
      Return the value of the key from the current ScopedContext, if there is one and the key exists.
      Parameters:
      key - The key.
      Returns:
      The value of the key in the current ScopedContext.

    • getString

      String getString(String key)
      Return the value of the key from the current ScopedContext, if there is one and the key exists.
      Parameters:
      key - The key.
      Returns:
      The value of the key in the current ScopedContext converted to String.

    • newScopedContext

      ScopedContext.Instance newScopedContext()
      Creates a new context containing the current context data from ThreadContext.
      Returns:
      A new instance of a scoped context.

    • newScopedContext

      ScopedContext.Instance newScopedContext(String key, Object value)
      Creates a new context containing the current context data from ThreadContext.
      Parameters:
      key - An additional key for the context.
      value - An additional value for the context.
      Returns:
      A new instance of a scoped context.

    • newScopedContext

      ScopedContext.Instance newScopedContext(Map<String,?> map)
      Creates a new context containing the current context data from ThreadContext.
      Parameters:
      map - Additional data to include in the context.
      Returns:
      A new instance of a scoped context.

    • newScopedContext

      ScopedContext.Instance newScopedContext(boolean withThreadContext)
      Creates a new context indicating that the ThreadContext should be included.
      Parameters:
      withThreadContext - true if the ThreadContext should be included.
      Returns:
      A new instance of a scoped context.
